Key Match Events: India win by seven wickets with 117 balls remaining
WICKET! India 156-3 (Rohit c Iftikhar b Afridi 86)
WICKET! India 79-2 (Kohli c Babar b Hasan 16)
WICKET! India 23-1 (Gill c Shadab b Afridi 16)
Wicket! Hasan Ali c Gill b Jadeja 12 (Pakistan 187-9)
Wicket! Mohammad Nawaz c Bumrah b Hardik 4 (Pakistan 187-8)
WICKET! Imam-ul-Haq c Rahul b Hardik 36 (Pakistan 73-2)
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma speaks: 'The bowlers set the game up for us. Restricting them to 190 was a great effort – at one stage we were looking at 270/280. We pride ourselves on the fact that whoever gets the ball does the job for the team. It’s my job as captain to read the conditions and decide who is the best guy to bowl. We’ve been very clear with what we want to do: who bats in what position and what happens if someone isn’t fit. Guys got runs and wickets going into the World Cup, so all in all it’s looking good. We don’t want to get too excited or too low. It’s a long tournament and we want to stay balanced. That is the key.'

The Pakistan captain Babar Azam speaks: 'We started well, then suddenly we collapsed in the middle overs. It’s not good. We were aiming for 280/290 but that collapse cost us. With the new ball we were not up to the mark, though Rohit played an outstanding innings.'

The player of the match is … Jasprit Bumrah. He did bowl beautifully (7-1-19-2), but I assumed it would be Rohit. Anyway, here’s what he had to say: 'It felt good. We try to analyse the wicket as soon as possible; we realised it was on the slower side and that a hard length would make run-scoring difficult. We knew as the ball got a little older it might reverse and grip a little bit. We were waiting for that and trying to make it as difficult as possible.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: It’s now India 8-0 Pakistan at ODI World Cups, and this is the most emphatic win of the lot. Their captain Rohit Sharma was inspired with both brain and bat. First he presided over an almighty Pakistan collapse from 155/2 to 191 all out; then he pre-empted any new-ball ferocity from Pakistan by whacking six sixes in a 63-ball 86.
India recorded the fastest ODI run chase against Pakistan, finishing with almost 20 overs to spare.
